means: （使）破裂[分裂，粉碎]，（使）崩溃( disintegrate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The plane disintegrated as it fell into the sea.
sentence.Network_cn: 飞机坠入大海时解体了。

sentence.Network_en: The box was so old ; it just disintegrated when I picked it up.
sentence.Network_cn: 那箱子太破旧了,我刚一提就散了.

sentence.Network_en: The rocks are disintegrated by frost and rain.

PerfectNetExp.abs: we did not have to fight Soviets . even though they were a nuclear power they collapsed and disintegrated .我们不需要发动和苏联的战争，甚至他们有了核武器也无法改变崩溃和解体的结局。
Years later the films disintegrated but a few frames were still existent in 1953 ., 几年以后 , 电影胶片碎裂了 , 但是到 1953年仍旧存在几幅画面.

list.abs: disintegration 衰变disintegration constant 衰变常数disintegrator 粉碎机
radioactive deposit 放射性沉积物radioactive disintegration 放射性衰变radioactive element 放射性元素
disintegration 分解disintegration chain 蜕变链disintegration constant 蜕变常数
scheme中文 ... disintegration rate ||衰变速率 disintegration scheme||衰变图 disintegration sequence ||衰变系列.

entry.def: If something disintegrates, it becomes seriously weakened, and is divided or destroyed.

example.ex: During October 1918 the Austro-Hungarian Empire began to disintegrate.
example.tran: 在 1918 年 10 月间，奥匈帝国开始瓦解。

entry.def: If an object or substance disintegrates, it breaks into many small pieces or parts and is destroyed.

example.tran: 挡风玻璃在时速420英里时破碎。

auth_sentence.content: Never has an empire disintegrated with so little bloodshed.
auth_sentence.res_content: Never has an empire disintegrated with so little bloodshed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Never has an empire disintegrated with so little bloodshed.

auth_sentence.content: Family relations quickly disintegrated and the business ultimately faltered.

auth_sentence.content: The event disintegrated, leaving some Communists quite aggrieved.
